Math 221 - Calculus I
Spring 2021

Instructor: Victor Kreiman
Office: GRNQ 331
Email Address: kreiman@uwp.edu
Phone Number: 262-595-2231
Webpage: vkreiman.github.io


Meeting Place and Times
Synchronous online, 9:00 - 9:53 am M - F

Textbook
Stewart, Calculus, 8th edition (2012), Cengage

Online Lectures
Live lectures will be delivered virtually during class times. To attend these lectures, login to Canvas, then go to Collaborate Ultra. Every lecture will also be recorded and will be available for viewing approximately one hour after the time of the live lecture.

Online Quizzes and Exams
During the appropriate quiz or exam time, you should download the quiz or exam from Canvas, and then write down your solutions on paper. Then, either take pictures of your solutions on your phone or scan them onto a computer, and upload back to Canvas. Your upload will have to be in pdf format. (The app Adobe Scan allows you to convert pictures on your phone to pdf format.) There will be a practice quiz on Wednesday February 3, in order for you to practice this procedure.

Course Description
Introductory differential and integral calculus and applications. Topics include rate of change and limits, continuity, differentiation, applications of the derivative, integration, applications of the integral, and transcendental functions. We will cover most of chapters 1 - 6 from the textbook.

Homework
The way to learn mathematics is to first try to understand the concepts, and then apply your understanding to solve problems. Homework problems will be assigned in class; most will be taken from the textbook. You may certainly discuss homework problems with others, but I recommend that you first try to solve them on your own.

Grading
Graded work will include a final exam, three in-class exams, and periodic quizzes. The final exam will be on Saturday May 8, 1 - 3 pm. Each of the in-class exams will be announced in class at least one week before it is given.The final grade will be calculated using the following weights: quizzes 20%; in-class exams 20% each; final exam 20%. Your lowest two quiz scores will be dropped. The following grading scale will be applied: 90 - 100 A, 80 - 89 B, 70 - 79 C, 60 - 69 D, 0 - 59 F.

Missed work
In-class exams and quizzes may be made up in the event of documented illness.

Calculators
Calculators are not allowed on exams or quizzes and not required for the course.

Help
You can always see me if you have any questions. Free tutoring is available to all students at Wyllie D180 (262-595-2044, tutoring.center@uwp.edu).

Academic Accommodation
It is the policy and practice of UW - Parkside to create inclusive work environments. If there are aspects of the instruction or design of this course that result in barriers to your inclusion, please notify me as soon as possible. You are also welcome to contact the Office of Disability Services, telephone 262-595-2372, or email Dr. Renee Sartin Kirby at kirby@uwp.edu. For more information, visit the DSS website at http://www.uwp.edu/departments/disability.services.

Electronic Devices
The use of cell phones, smart phones, or other mobile communication devices is disruptive, and is therefore prohibited during class. Except in emergencies, those using such devices must leave the classroom for the remainder of the class period. The use of computers, including tablets and laptops, is prohibited in the classroom.

Disclaimer
The course syllabus is a general plan for the course; deviations announced in class may be necessary.
